result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:02 PM (64-06) Defendant Edgar R Martinez in court.  Attorney Lauren Stuckert in court for Edgar R Martinez.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Herrmann in court. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Stuckert acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to the charge on behalf of her client.
Attorney requesting Status be heard with Refusal Hearing set on 11/30/2022 at 2:30PM
No objection.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edgar R Martinez in court.  Attorney Andrew Mishlove for Lauren Stuckert in court for Edgar R Martinez. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Time period waived. Minutes filed.

Motion to Modify Bail
Lauren Stuckert
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant in court with attorney Mishlove. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty must file motion ot modify bond. 22TR2190 needs to track with this case. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH OWNER. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
